page.title: 12Christleton Personality
page.content: Mr Cliff Boddly is 73 years old and has lived in the Village all his life. His family have lived here for over 200 years.He started school at 3 years of age at the Girls and Infants school where he was taught by the Blacksmiths wife.At 5 he transfered to the boys school near the Church and later had a scholarship to Love St.School in Chester.At 16 he had his school certificate and became an apprentice silversmith in Chester.He has been a member of the Parish Church choir for 62 years.Today he acts as Rectors Warden and carries out duties in the Church every day.He remembers vividly many special events in village life, particularly the fete, Beating of the Bounds and St James Day Festivals.He spends his sparetime compiling family histories on parchment,and illustrates them himself with colourful devices.
